Name: Greyhound
Ingredients: 5 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Review: Classically a Greyhound is merely vodka and grapefruit juice served tall over ice in a Collins glass, but it's better served shorter with a couple of flavour-enhancing embellishments (added by yours truly).
History: A lesser known relative to the Salty Dog. The earliest recipe I have found is in Stanley M. Jones 1977 Jones' Complete Barguide .
Nutrition: One serving of Greyhound contains 134 calories
